00032 // Interface for the class Sequence. A sequence contains a single set
00033 // of variables, all at the same lexical level just like a strucuture
00034 // (and like a structure, it may contain other ctor types...). Unlike
00035 // a structure, a sequence defines a pattern that is repeated N times
00036 // for a sequence of N elements. Thus, Sequence { String name; Int32
00037 // age; } person; means a sequence of N persons where each contain a
00038 // name and age. The sequence can be arbitraily long (i.e., you don't
00039 // know N by looking at the sequence declaration.
00040 //
00041 // jhrg 9/14/94
00042 
00043 #ifndef _sequence_h
00044 #define _sequence_h 1
00045 
00046 #ifdef _GNUG_
00047 #pragma interface
00048 #endif
00049 
00050 #include <vector>
00051 #include "Pix.h"
00052 
00053 #ifndef _basetype_h
00054 #include "BaseType.h"
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #ifndef _constructor_h
00058 #include "Constructor.h"
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 #if defined(TRACE_NEW) && !defined(_trace_new_h)
00062 #include "trace_new.h"
00063 #endif
00064 
00067 typedef vector<BaseType *> BaseTypeRow;
00068 
00156 class Sequence: public Constructor {
00157 private:
00158     // Vector of templates for the variables in this sequence.
00159     std::vector<BaseType *> _vars;
00160 
00161     // This holds the values read off the wire. Values are stored in
00162     // instances of BaseType objects.
00163     std::vector<BaseTypeRow *> d_values;
00164 
00165     // The number of the row that has just been deserialized. Before
00166     // deserialized has been called, this member is -1. 
00167     int d_row_number;
00168 
00169     // If a client asks for certain rows of a sequence using the bracket
00170     // notation (<tt>[<start>:<stride>:<stop>]</tt>) primarily intended for 
00171     // arrays
00172     // and grids, record that information in the next three members. This
00173     // information can be used by the translation software. s.a. the accessor
00174     // and mutator methods for these members. Values of -1 indicate that
00175     // these have not yet been set.
00176     int d_starting_row_number;
00177     int d_row_stride;
00178     int d_ending_row_number;
00179 
00180     // Make sure the old deserialize is still around.
00181     bool old_deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00182 
00183     void _duplicate(const Sequence &s);
00184     BaseType *leaf_match(const string &name, btp_stack *s = 0);
00185     BaseType *exact_match(const string &name, btp_stack *s = 0);
00186 
00187     bool is_end_of_rows(int i);
00188 
00189 protected:
00190     void write_end_of_sequence(XDR *sink);
00191     void write_start_of_instance(XDR *sink);
00192     unsigned char read_marker(XDR *source);
00193     bool is_start_of_instance(unsigned char marker);
00194     bool is_end_of_sequence(unsigned char marker);
00195 
00196 public:
00197 
00198     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::const_iterator Vars_citer ;
00199     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::iterator Vars_iter ;
00200     Sequence(const string &n = "");
00201 
00202     Sequence(const Sequence &rhs);
00203 
00204     virtual ~Sequence();
00205 
00206     Sequence &operator=(const Sequence &rhs);
00207 
00208     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00209 
00210     virtual string toString();
00211 
00212     virtual int element_count(bool leaves = false);
00213 
00214     virtual bool is_linear();
00215 
00216     virtual void set_send_p(bool state);
00217     virtual void set_read_p(bool state);
00218     virtual void set_in_selection(bool state);
00219 
00220     virtual unsigned int width();
00221 
00222     virtual int length();
00223     
00224     int number_of_rows();
00225 
00226     virtual bool read_row(int row, const string &dataset, DDS &dds, 
00227               bool ce_eval = true);
00228 
00229     virtual bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00230                bool ce_eval = true);
00231 
00232     virtual bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00233 
00234     int get_starting_row_number();
00235 
00236     int get_row_stride();
00237 
00238     int get_ending_row_number();
00239 
00240     void set_row_number_constraint(int start, int stop, int stride = 1);
00241 
00242     // Move me!
00243     virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *val, bool reuse = false);
00244     virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00245 
00246     virtual BaseType *var(const string &n, bool exact = true,
00247               btp_stack *s = 0);
00248     virtual BaseType *var(const string &n, btp_stack &s);
00249 
00250     BaseType *var_value(size_t row, const string &name);
00251 
00252     BaseType *var_value(size_t row, size_t i);
00253 
00254     BaseTypeRow *row_value(size_t row);
00255 
00256     virtual void add_var(BaseType *, Part part = nil);
00261     Vars_iter var_begin() ;
00262 
00266     Vars_iter var_end() ;
00267 
00268     Vars_iter get_vars_iter(int i);
00269 
00270     Pix first_var();
00271 
00272     void next_var(Pix p);
00273 
00274     BaseType *var(Pix p);
00275 
00276     virtual void print_decl(ostream &os, string space = "    ",
00277                 bool print_semi = true,
00278                 bool constraint_info = false,
00279                 bool constrained = false);
00280 
00281     virtual void print_decl(FILE *out, string space = "    ",
00282                 bool print_semi = true,
00283                 bool constraint_info = false,
00284                 bool constrained = false);
00285 
00286     virtual void print_one_row(ostream &os, int row, string space,
00287                    bool print_row_num = false);
00288 
00289      virtual void print_one_row(FILE *out, int row, string space,
00290                    bool print_row_num = false);
00291 
00292    virtual void print_val_by_rows(ostream &os, string space = "",
00293                    bool print_decl_p = true,
00294                    bool print_row_numners = true);
00295 
00296     virtual void print_val_by_rows(FILE *out, string space = "",
00297                    bool print_decl_p = true,
00298                    bool print_row_numbers = true);
00299 
00300     virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "",
00301                bool print_decl_p = true);
00302 
00303     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "",
00304                bool print_decl_p = true);
00305 
00306     virtual void print_all_vals(ostream& os, XDR *src, DDS *dds, 
00307                 string space = "", bool print_decl_p = true);
00308 
00309     virtual void print_all_vals(FILE *out, XDR *src, DDS *dds, 
00310                 string space = "", bool print_decl_p = true);
00311 
00312     virtual bool check_semantics(string &msg, bool all = false);
00313 
00314 };

00394  * Significant changes to the var(...) methods. These now take a btp_stack
00395  * pointer and are used by DDS::mark(...). The exact_match methods have also
00396  * been updated so that leaf variables which contain dots in their names
00397  * will be found. Note that constructor variables with dots in their names
00398  * will break the lookup routines unless the ctor is the last field in the
00399  * constraint expression. These changes were made to fix bug 330.

00412  *
00413  * Revision 1.45.4.3  2001/09/07 00:38:35  jimg
00414  * Sequence::deserialize(...) now reads all the sequence values at once.
00415  * Its call semantics are the same as the other classes' versions. Values
00416  * are stored in the Sequence object using a vector<BaseType *> for each
00417  * row (those are themselves held in a vector). Three new accessor methods
00418  * have been added to Sequence (row_value() and two versions of var_value()).
00419  * BaseType::deserialize(...) now always returns true. This matches with the
00420  * expectations of most client code (the seqeunce version returned false
00421  * when it was done reading, but all the calls for sequences must be changed
00422  * anyway). If an XDR error is found, deserialize throws InternalErr.
00423  *
00424  * Revision 1.46  2001/06/15 23:49:02  jimg
00425  * Merged with release-3-2-4.
00426  *
00427  * Revision 1.45.4.2  2001/06/05 06:49:19  jimg
00428  * Added the Constructor class which is to Structures, Sequences and Grids
00429  * what Vector is to Arrays and Lists. This should be used in future
00430  * refactorings (I thought it was going to be used for the back pointers).
00431  * Introduced back pointers so children can refer to their parents in
00432  * hierarchies of variables.
00433  * Added to Sequence methods to tell if a child sequence is done
00434  * deserializing its data.
00435  * Fixed the operator=() and copy ctors; removed redundency from
00436  * _duplicate().
00437  * Changed the way serialize and deserialize work for sequences. Now SOI and
00438  * EOS markers are written for every `level' of a nested Sequence. This
00439  * should fixed nested Sequences. There is still considerable work to do
00440  * for these to work in all cases.

00450  *
00451  * Revision 1.44  2000/09/21 16:22:08  jimg
00452  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00453  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00454  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00455  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00456  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00457  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
00458  *
00459  * Revision 1.43  2000/09/11 16:31:33  jimg
00460  * Added methods to make it simpler to access Sequences by row number. The new
00461  * methods are: get_row(), get_row_number(), get_starting_row_number(),
00462  * get_ending_row_number(), get_row_stride(), set_row_number_constraint(). The
00463  * starting and ending row numbers refer to constraints placed on the sequence,
00464  * to get the number of rows in the current sequence, use the length() method.

00553  * Multiple connections are now possible. It is now possible to open several

00557  * source `object' (which is just an XDR pointer).

00597  * Revision 1.11  1995/05/10  13:45:28  jimg
00598  * Changed the name of the configuration header file from `config.h' to
00599  * `config_dap.h' so that other libraries could have header files which were
00600  * installed in the DODS include directory without overwriting this one. Each
00601  * config header should follow the convention config_<name>.h.
00602  *
00603  * Revision 1.10  1995/03/04  14:35:04  jimg
00604  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00605  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00606  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00607  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00608  * class represenation.
00609  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00610  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00611  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00612  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00613  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00614  * C would store them.
00615  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00616  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00617  * objects).
00618  *
00619  * Revision 1.9  1995/02/10  02:23:01  jimg
00620  * Added DBMALLOC includes and switch to code which uses malloc/free.
00621  * Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00622  * Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00623  * will be removed in a future release.
00624  * Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00625  * internal buffer.
00626  * Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00627  * Fixed read_val().
00628  * Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00629  * cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
